Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Large op-return data makes the xtn take longer to move around the p2p network

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so if you are pushing a lot of data, take that into account

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there is a concept of "locked funds" as well

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not sure if that is coming into play

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `listlockunspent`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: make sure to call that RPC and make sure stuff isn't locked, maybe?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is mostly for shielded stuff

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but I think taddr utxos can be locked, too

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you look in the KMD source code, there are magical `sleep`'s all over to make the magic sauce taste just right

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's part of the design of Bitcoin, nothing is perfect

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Sometimes you must wait for other threads or the p2p network or whatever

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I still don't know that you are describing a "bug" or are "not checking error conditions correctly"

Author: Alright#0419
Content: are you setting the arg for minconfs?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: needs to be set to 0

Author: Alright#0419
Content: arg 3, set it to 0 or it won't spend from mempool

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
3. minconf                 (numeric, optional, default=1) Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.
```

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi,
If I wanted to 'digitalize' a physical asset, my house for example, for trading what kind of advantages/disavantages would there be to using 'tokens' rather than a '-ac_name=MYHOUSE' chain?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Would both methods allow trading through `mm2` and `channels`?

Author: CMaurice#1685
Content: depends what you want to do with it, I guess: if you want to sell the legal title outright, then it could be represented by a single non-fungible token. If you wanted to sell shares in it, perhaps as rights to future rental income or something, then many tokens or a whole chain might be abetter idea

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: block reward for doing the dishes.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
the main obstacle to digitize physical assets is the need for an "Enforcer"
if that problem is solved, i.e., a trusted enforcer agrees to enforce a trade of digital representations of physical assets on a specific blockchain in the real world
then, 
using '-ac_name=MYHOUSE' will look like:
you could start the chain with say 10,000 supply and each coin represents 1/10000 th share of the house
these coins  can traded with cryptos or other similarly digitised assets using mm2 without much effort
 
using tokens:
the house is represented by a NFT
it can be traded for other tokens. these tokens can be similar NFTs that represent assets or other cryptos brought on chain through gateways

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: trading on mm2 would be single chain

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: a realestate portfolio where renters have to mine as a condition of lease would ensure full nodes active (maybe redeemable for discounts on rent like a free week per year, along with founder rewards to keep supply balanced)

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
I was thinking along the lines of selling 'shares' in the house.
The 'shares' would be tradeable with other digital assets and crypto.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CrisF interesting idea, but you need to have laws to protect you and laws require people with sticks to enforce them. I have dealt with people squatting illegally on my property and it's not something you want to deal with, and then add in a blockchain. It would be interesting to only sell shares to very well "vetted" people that have some type of collateral they don't want to lose (like their reputation) for screwing you over in this experiment

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i.e. try it out with KMD core people that are "trusted", that could be interesting

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi @dukeleto üëã
This would be the `"Enforcer"` that @gcharang mentioned right?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not really

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you need an enforcer with the law on their side

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: otherwise, you will have people living rent free for 6+ months, before you have the legal right to remove them

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so if your "agreement" is "not understandable" to the local police, that is not good

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you *will* need a "house enforcer" but it's more like somebody that takes on extra duty to help people get along, they don't have a huge amount of power to "enforce" somebody leave if they stop paying rent

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: many AirBnB's have a person like that

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
In this case I wouldn't have to do this myself.  
What I'm trying to do is make a simple demo showing off Komodo technology through a basic example.
This topic has come up in almost every serious conversation I've been having with people over here (Japan, but European and Middle Eastern projects) recently.
A simple run through showing off our platform and tech would be very powerful in moving these conversations to the next level.
I've heard that there are some projects working on this in Japan and will be finding out more about this next week.

Author: miraculu#8334
Content:
Good day guys, Please I need help. 
I've been thinking of how to make a pool on a smart Chain. 
The aim is to allow users vote for each other, And once the vote is complete I'll make an airdrop based on the vote. (I need to be able to query what users were voted for and how much votes they each got) 
NB: I don't want to learn any advanced KMD development, I want to achieve this as a normal Dev, who is building on a smart chain via RPC calls.

Any contribution is highly appreciated.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Komodo run a voting chain where all KMD holders are airdropped 1:1 with the VOTE coin. Then airdrop your actual coin manually based on the winners or however the voting works. You could use a similar method to this?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Smart Chains are easy and free to create.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: It is your own blockchain and can grow as big as you like.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: No cost apart from your servers, and can have nothing to do with Komodo (apart from running on Komodo software).

Content: You set up 2 servers (one is possible). They connect through p2p network.
